moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c5 4. cxd5 cxd4:
The schara henning gambit
i don't recommand it with black in long games
moves.5... Bd7: the strongest, but Qd7 is also possible
moves.8. Nf3 Nf6 9. Qd1:
4 queen moves in the 9 first white moves ;
that is the point black will try to point out.
Qb3 have also been tried, but Qd1 seems stronger.
white have one pawn advance, but all this is the main theorical line
moves.9... Bc5 10. e3 Qe7:
black have fully developed their pieces. 
Qe2 is a strong move that allows: black to O-O or O-O-O, avoid e4, protects the bishop ! 
anyway, e4 for white must be played very carefully
white moves have to be precise, because black have a superior development.
moves.11. Be2 O-O-O: O-O ! is perhaps stronger, but practically, O-O-O offers good chances to black in short games.
moves.12. a3: this move have been played in long game, but i prefer O-O
moves.12... Bh3: fritz proposes here Nd2 here, keeping the pawn
moves.13. Qc2 Bxg2 14. Rg1 Bxf3 15. Bxf3 Nd4:
an interesting suite. fritz 9  0.34 for black 
the thematic move is Ne5
moves.20. Ra2: a strange way to develop Queen side pieces
moves.22. Qe2: fritz find also this move with  0.84 for black
moves.22... Kb8 23. Bb2 Rdc8: c3 knight cannot move.  c2 is very week, due to a bad organisation
moves.24. Rc1 Bc7 25. Kg2 Nh5:
musch better was Be5 . but i wanted to start my attack at king side by f5.
anyway the knight is unactive there
moves.27. Kh1 f5 28. Qa4: Qa4 ? blocking the a pawn.  0.91 for black
moves.35... fxe3 36. fxe3 Bxe3: black are realizing a full pawn.
moves.37. Re1: a very difficult decision but rook f1 was a little bit stronger, becasue of the black response  1.50 for black
moves.37... Rd2: Rd2 ! the rook and the bishop are not takeable !
moves.38. Re2 Rxc2 39. Rxc2: the c2 weekness is still there ! the white pieces have not progressed and have  the same configuration as move 23 !
moves.39... Bd4 40. Rc1 Nf4 41. Nd1: Nd1 ??  the following black move forces resignation. can you find it ?
